snippet: Iran has long been a pariah, but Saudi Arabia’s embrace of the death penalty and its support of extremist Sunni ideology has hardened some Western attitudes.
abstract: European leaders grow increasingly wary of Saudi Arabia, its main ally and trading partner in Middle East, after kingdom's execution of Shiite cleric draws Iran's ire; worry rivalry between regional powers threatens Europe's newly improved relations with Iran, and warn stability in region is impossible without two countries' cooperation.
lead_paragraph: Iran has long been a pariah, but Saudi Arabia’s embrace of the death penalty and its support of extremist Sunni ideology has hardened some Western attitudes.

headline.main: European Sympathies Lean Toward Iran in Conflict With Saudi Arabia
headline.print_headline: European Sympathies Lean Toward Iran in Its Confrontation With Saudi Arabia
